byline.original: By ADAM NAGOURNEY, RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and CLIFFORD KRAUSS
byline.contributor: Adam Nagourney reported from Goleta, Richard Pérez-Peña from New York, and Clifford Krauss from Houston. Mark Storer contributed reporting from Goleta.

lead_paragraph: Up to 21,000 gallons of crude oil reached the sea near Santa Barbara after a leak in a pipeline linking a large offshore rig to refineries.

headline.print_headline: Oil Again Fouling Coast Near Site of Historic Spill
headline.main: Oil Again Fouling California Coast Near Site of Historic Spill

snippet: Up to 21,000 gallons of crude oil reached the sea near Santa Barbara after a leak in a pipeline linking a large offshore rig to refineries.
abstract: Oil spill from broken pipeline near Refugio State Beach on California coast, while serious at 21,000 gallons, does not pose threat as great as 1969 spill that dumped three million gallons of oil in same area; nearly 400 people are involved in round-the-clock cleanup effort at beach.
